CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, Febuary 19, 1955, page 12, reads: "Aided March of Dimes - This group of youngsters from 6 to 9 years of age had banded themselves together to help others. Their first project was to empty their treasury and sacrifice a few things in order to help with the Mother's March of Dimes. Their sponsor is Mrs. Gladys McNairy, who in turn gave the children's money to the Hill District March of Dimes, of which Mrs. Eunice W. Cook is chairman. in group are Francine McNairy, president; Frances harper, vice president; Gail Pratt, secretary; Patricia Lonon, treasurer; Jacqueline Norris, Jacqueline Wilson, Cheryl Johnson, Gretchen Jones, Charlene Adams and Mrs. Annie Harper. - Harris photo"
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of two women, possibly Gladys McNairy and Annie Harper, and seven girls, fundraising for March of Dimes, including one holding doll, and another on left wearing plaid skirt, dark knitted socks, and light colored cardigan holding small weaving loom, posed in living room with dark patterned fringed sofa, floral rug, and abstract lamps, another version
